d35_u1.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d35_u1.utterance: Hi, Dawn. Nice to meet you.

d35_u3.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d35_u3.prev_utt: Nice to meet you, too. Thanks for coming in today.

d35_u5.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d35_u5.prev_utt: Yeah. Tell me a little bit about yourself.
d35_u5.utterance: So I am, um, 28. And I moved out to Arizona about six months ago. Um, I really enjoy spending time with my family and hanging out with friends whenever I can. Work keeps me pretty busy. Um, But I'm really, um, looking to kind of make some changes to my diet and physical activity. I'm not really happy with where my weight's at right now, and, uh, so I thought it'd be good to come and talk with you about some of that stuff.

d35_u7.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d35_u7.prev_utt: Yeah, you're feeling a little bit dissatisfied with your health patterns?
d35_u7.utterance: Yeah. Um, I'm really starting to notice how I feel more sluggish and just not-- My mood is shifted a lot too, which at first, I thought was because it's getting colder outside, um, but I do also think it maybe has some relation to my activity, or lack thereof, and also kind of the foods that I'm eating.

d35_u9.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d35_u9.prev_utt: Okay, so you're feeling some low energy and you know, in the past, when you've been more active and eating differently, you've had more energy?
d35_u9.utterance: Right. Yeah. Especially during times when I'm more active is when I noticed the biggest change in energy and mood.

d35_u11.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d35_u11.prev_utt: Yeah. Tell me more about that, those previous times that you've been active.
d35_u11.utterance: Yeah. Um, well, I played sports in college, so that kept me pretty busy, and that was really fun, um, and I just think back now to, as much that I would cram into a 24 -hour period, and like, wonder how I did that, but I think that part of it was because I was so active physically, um, I just had way more energy throughout the day, mentally and physically to, um, you know, go to school full-time and-and still socialize with friends and do all that stuff. Um, so when I think back to like, probably like the peak of my life of when I felt my best physically, mentally it was that time.

d35_u13.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d35_u13.prev_utt: You had energy, and you were like the Energizer Bunny, just keep going and going and going.
d35_u13.utterance: Yeah, yeah, exactly. And now it's not so much the same. Um, like when I get home from work, I'm pretty exhausted, uh, it takes a lot for me to want to be physically active when I've spent all day staring at a computer and thinking and working. And so, um, yeah, that's probably been my biggest, uh, issue is like when work ends, going home and not really doing anything. Um, just trying to like unwind by watching Netflix or something else, right?

d35_u15.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d35_u15.prev_utt: So your days are just as full now that you're working and a career person, um, and your energy level isn't what it used to be. What-- Do you have any ideas about why that might have shifted?
d35_u15.utterance: Um, well, I think part of it is that when I was in college, it wasn't really an option to go, like, I had to go to practice or I had to do those things because that was, in a sense, my job that was paying for school, um, and now there's not that same commitment to other people or to scholarship money. So that definitely has shifted, um, but I-I do feel like an urgency to go it just doesn't seem that like the step that's missing is for me to actually go to a gym or somewhere to be more active. Like, I think I want to it's just the doing it that seems to not happen.

d35_u19.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d35_u19.prev_utt: I want to be more physically active than I've been.
d35_u19.utterance: Yeah, yeah, I think so. Um, that's not to say like, I wanna go run a marathon but I do think that it would help me a lot in terms of just having a better outlook on life, um, and better energy to- if I were to pick up some type of activity.

d35_u23.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d35_u23.prev_utt: Tell me more about that. What do you notice specifically about your mood on the days you're physically active?
d35_u23.utterance: Just, I'm-I'm just happier and more upbeat and I think that even my outlook is more positive. So like, if I'm sitting in traffic, and I haven't been physically active, I'll probably grumble about it but if I'm sitting in traffic, and I have been, it's like, I just have a different outlook on things and I already feel like I've gotten something accomplished that day. So it just kind of like helps with that ripple effect into my day of like getting more things done.

d35_u25.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d35_u25.prev_utt: Yeah, you feel more accomplished and-and you feel less irritated by the small stuff.

d35_u27.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d35_u27.prev_utt: Great. Well, let me see if I've got this all. You came to Arizona six months ago, you're trying to figure out new rhythms and patterns for yourself. You're looking back at the past few years, and in college, you were real active because you were an athlete, and now it's more up to you about making that choice of physical activity, and you're discovering that, um, not being active has affected your energy level and your mood, and that's something you're looking for more of, both of those things, energy and-and a mood booster.
d35_u27.utterance: Yeah. And then also to, um, like I mentioned, I'm not totally happy with my weight, um, and so hoping too that that would have some impact there and-and maybe help me, um, if my activity kind of gets resolved or improves, then my nutrition also, maybe would go along with it and get better.

d35_u29.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d35_u29.prev_utt: Yeah. Tell me more about your weight concerns. When did you start feeling dissatisfied with your body?
d35_u29.utterance: Uh, probably about three, four months ago. Um, yeah, just my clothes started fitting tighter, which wasn't as comfortable, and, um, yeah, just not really super happy with my appearance, which has never really been an issue, um, in my life up until now. I've usually been pretty okay with that, and then in the last three months, I just feel, um, like I've had a lot more of a negative outlook on it.

d35_u31.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d35_u31.prev_utt: Mm-hmm. Okay, so it sounds like a sort of a vicious cycle and-and maybe the lacking physical activity has made you feel less confident in yourself. I wonder if that's also a piece of this puzzle since you mentioned that's been a big difference from what was happening in the past.
d35_u31.utterance: Yeah, I think- I think the activity piece and then also to like, the foods that I'm eating, I don't think are that great. So that also kind of does the same thing, I think, to my appearance or the way that I viewed myself.

d35_u33.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d35_u33.prev_utt: Okay. So you had a pretty strong self-confidence, pretty strong body image all the way up until a few months ago and, um, you're hoping to kind of get back to that place where you feel good about yourself.

d120_u1.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d120_u1.prev_utt: Well, I'm glad we figured that out and I think you'll feel better over the next few days.
d120_u1.utterance: Oh, thanks so much doctor. I'll just take it easy for a couple of days.

d120_u3.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d120_u3.prev_utt: Well, since I have you here and we still have a few minutes left, I'd like to bring up another topic. I noticed that your blood pressure and your weight have been climbing a bit over the past few years. We haven't really had time to talk about this much before and I may be able to offer some useful strategies. Would it be okay if we discussed weight and health for a few minutes?
d120_u3.utterance: Yeah, I suppose. I know my weight is a problem, but every time I try to take it off, I end up gaining it back. I don't know what to do.

d120_u5.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d120_u5.prev_utt: I know how you feel. Managing weight can be frustrating. Maybe we can just start trying to figure it out together and I'll be here to help you through the challenges.
d120_u5.utterance: Okay, thank you doctor, but I'm just concerned about how I can possibly lose weight now since work is so busy and the kids take up so much of my time.

d120_u7.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d120_u7.prev_utt: Yeah, that's certainly understandable. We both know that there's a lot that plays into weight management, but there's no need to figure it all out today, especially since things are so busy for you right now. Maybe we could put our heads together and think about something small that fits reasonably into your life and then we can take further steps when you're ready.
d120_u7.utterance: Okay, that sounds great. So, what should I do?

d120_u9.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d120_u9.prev_utt: Well, let's see. One of the things that's involved in managing weight and health is being active. Physical activity benefits the whole body. It's healthy for our joints, our stress levels, and especially for weight management. Perhaps we could talk about some ways of adding activity that fit into your life.
d120_u9.utterance: I knew you were gonna say that, but I don't have time in my schedule. I can't afford to take an hour to go to the gym every day.

d120_u11.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d120_u11.prev_utt: Well, I understand that. I don't have an hour to go to the gym every day either, but one of the great things about physical activity is that any amount in any type of activity can be very helpful. For example, let's think about some activities that you enjoy doing.

d120_u13.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d120_u13.prev_utt: Me too. Walking is great exercise.
d120_u13.utterance: Wait a minute, isn't walking too mild to help you lose weight, though?

d120_u15.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d120_u15.prev_utt: Actually, even just a few minutes of walking is really healthy and worthwhile, and then when you have time to do even more, that's great. Walking is also great because you can do it anywhere, it doesn't need to be at the gym.
d120_u15.utterance: Oh, wow, that sounds good. You know what? Come to think of it, I have some time before I have to go back to work and I saw a nice park on the way over here, maybe I can take a short walk after this appointment.

d120_u17.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d120_u17.utterance: And you know what? I used to really love to dance, but I haven't done that in such a long time.

d120_u19.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d120_u19.prev_utt: Well, dancing is a great exercise, especially because it's fun.
d120_u19.utterance: Hmm. And I know my family would support me if I could just find some place where I can go dancing.

d120_u21.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d120_u21.prev_utt: Oh, that's great to hear that your family is so supportive. And I bet there's a dance class somewhere around where you live or maybe even a dance fitness class at the gym.
d120_u21.utterance: Yeah, and you know what? I really like to try that.

d120_u23.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d120_u23.prev_utt: Would you like to do some research on this and give it a shot?
d120_u23.utterance: Actually, I really would. I'm kind of excited about it. What else you got?

d120_u25.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d120_u25.prev_utt: Well, small steps can go a long way. So, even things like taking the stairs instead of the elevator every once in a while or parking just a bit further from the door when you go to a store can be ways to increase movement in your day.

d120_u27.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d120_u27.prev_utt: How about we start there and let's plan to follow up in a few weeks so we can see how it's going and then maybe talk about some other strategies that might help.

d120_u29.topic: more exercise / increasing activity; weight loss
d120_u29.prev_utt: Not necessarily. What we eat is certainly important for weight and health, but just like we did today, we can talk about some small steps that can fit into your life, and especially ones that you feel good about.
d120_u29.utterance: Yeah, I like that. Okay, I'll make an appointment and I'll start dancing right away, doc.

d54_u3.prev_utt: Um, we were talking a little bit earlier, and you said you wanted to talk about exercising.

d54_u5.utterance: Well, I just can't seem to get back in the gym. I don't wanna-- I-I used to work out quite a bit, and in the last, I dunno, couple of years I've just-- I stopped going. I got busy, and now I'm out of the habit, and I-I really, I dunno, I feel like I need to get back.

d54_u7.prev_utt: Well, I mean, I think you just need to maybe sit down and write down a list of reasons why you need to get back to the gym, and then on the other side of the list, put down, you know, um, ideas about what's going to help you get there.

d54_u9.prev_utt: What gym do you belong to?
d54_u9.utterance: Uh, I belong to the-the Sport Fitness Center.

d54_u11.prev_utt: Okay. And-and how far away is it from your house?

d54_u13.prev_utt: Just a couple of miles. Mm. So you-- you know, you could, like, ride your bike or walk there, and it would be good too.
d54_u13.utterance: If I walked that far, I probably wouldn't even need to go to the gym, right?

d54_u19.prev_utt: Yeah. So why-why do you want to-- what do you wanna do with that? You want to look different, or--?
d54_u19.utterance: Well, I-I-I-I would feel better. My-- I'd-I'd be able to wear more my clothes. I've been growing around the middle and I'd like to, uh, you know, go back to where I was, you know, get into a 34, 36 waist, you know.

d54_u21.utterance: I-I'm more comfortable-- I feel better. I think that's the main thing.

d54_u23.prev_utt: Okay. Yeah, because your-your health really, to me, it's more important than your-your looks. I mean, don't get me wrong, I understand what you're saying, but, you know, it'd be great to get back in those jeans, but
d54_u23.utterance: Yeah, yeah. It-it-it-- I-I am- I'm not getting any younger than I was before.

d54_u25.prev_utt: Mm-hmm. Well, I think you know what to do. You've done it before.

d54_u27.prev_utt: Yeah. Just a matter-- You just gotta do it.

d54_u39.prev_utt: All right, so I'll see you next week.

d56_u3.utterance: Yeah. Um, I'm glad to be there.

d56_u5.prev_utt: Yeah. What are you really glad about?
d56_u5.utterance: Uh, well, I'm glad to see my dog, he's very cute, and it just feels good to be home.

d56_u7.utterance: Yeah. And my garden is coming along, and my neighbors have stuff-- It's-it's good. It's good to be home.

d56_u9.prev_utt: I know, I-I understand that it was really-- That was your goal. That was a really important thing for you to be able to get home and it sounds like you've been able to really en- enjoy parts of it, and I know you've been going to the- both the physical therapy and the Tai Chi and how's-how's that going?
d56_u9.utterance: Well, um. I-I didn't get- go to physical therapy this week, and the- or Tai Chi, actually.

d56_u11.prev_utt: So, I'm wondering if something happened that that led you not to go. You look a little, um, down.
d56_u11.utterance: Yeah. Well, um. Actually, I-I had a little semi fall, I didn't fall down, I didn't fall down completely but I-I did-- I guess I still had the wobblies and I was hoping that the physical therapy and the Tai Chi would be- get me further along than it has, and I-I still don't have the balance. So, I'm thinking that maybe I was pushing too hard, that maybe I should cut back, you know, and kind of not try so hard to-to keep moving like that.

d56_u21.utterance: So I'm-I'm-I cut back, and I-I don't know if I should really even continue the Tai Chi because it's-it's very demanding.

d56_u23.prev_utt: Yeah, yeah. It's a lot of work.
d56_u23.utterance: Uh, it's beautiful and-and- but, um, yeah.

d56_u25.utterance: That I'll- that I'll fall again.

d56_u27.utterance: I'll really fall and hurt myself, and this way, if I don't move around so much, there's less chance that I will.

d56_u31.prev_utt: And what are- what are your concerns about-- It doesn't sound like you-you feel like you hurt yourself in this fall.
d56_u31.utterance: No, I didn't- it was just more scary, and it was like a-a signal that maybe I'm doing too much.

d56_u35.prev_utt: Yeah. And, what are you concerned will happen if-if you get hurt or if something-
d56_u35.utterance: Well, yeah, if I- if I lose my balance and fall down, I could- anything, you know, really get hurt, and then-then I wouldn't be able to be home anymore, and that's not what I want. I want to stay home. So I want to do what I have to do to-to-to stay home.

d56_u37.prev_utt: And it feels like the only way that you can really stay safe and not fall is to not do anything to kind of just hunker down.
d56_u37.utterance: Yeah. Yes, you've put it very well, hunker down-

d56_u39.utterance: Watch the TV and pet my dog. I-I, you know, not to that extreme, but yeah, I think- I think maybe, um, yeah, I was-was going- pushing too hard.

d56_u41.utterance: And I'm not sure about the Tai Chi anymore. I-I think the physical therapy, I can understand that, but I'm not so sure about the Tai Chi.

d56_u47.prev_utt: Um, I'm wondering what you remember about what-what Dr. Fields said about the Tai Chi in relationship to falls. Did she talk with you about that?
d56_u47.utterance: She did. Sh-- Yeah, that's right, that's right. She said that they did studies and that they found that it was really preventative. I think she's- I forget the-the percentage, but yeah, she was really enthusiastic and she does it herself.

d56_u51.prev_utt: Yeah. So you're feeling a little betrayed like it didn't-- "Look, and I did this, I was doing my Tai Chi, and all of a sudden, I- here, look at this, I fall."
d56_u51.utterance: That's a strong word, isn't it, "betrayed". Um, wow. A little, but-but I-I know, I know that it's true. I mean, my friend who does Tai Chi, she just- she loves it. Maybe it's just not for me, you know.

d56_u59.prev_utt: Wh-what do you think about that?
d56_u59.utterance: Absolutely, that- because I don't- now I'm-I'm feeling-

d56_u61.utterance: -really a little frightened that what if- what if I fall down and-and-and nobody comes around and I'm lying there for two days, you know. I may have heard about that.

d56_u69.prev_utt: What thoughts do you have about that? What have you heard that others have done, or what are- what are- what thoughts do you have?
d56_u69.utterance: Well, the-- I think that there's some things that could be done to-- I know people who live in-in residence, they have a cord they can pull, but how do they get to the cord? Um, is there any- anything else that I could do just to communicate if-if-

d56_u73.prev_utt: Yeah, yeah. I know what's worked for a lot of the-the folks that I've worked with is there's like- it's called a lifeline and they can wear it around their neck and it's hooked up and- so that if you need help, you can push the button.
d56_u73.utterance: I think I saw something like that on TV.

d56_u75.utterance: Is it- does it really work?

d56_u77.utterance: 'Cause you know that they sell so much stuff on TV, it's like you could-

d56_u81.prev_utt: No, it is something that there's a couple of different of, uh, you know, a couple of different products out there, but it-it does- it can really help, uh, and-and it kind of gives- might give you this sense of security that you have at your fingertips.
d56_u81.utterance: Yeah. I guess so, feeling a little scared-

d56_u85.utterance: So, yeah, it's probably a signal to-to make some-some changes.

d56_u87.utterance: Like I don't wanna go back to the hospital, right? I really don't. Do I have to?

d56_u91.prev_utt: So what do you think that will take, um, because you're the one that really knows how you're feeling about in the house and how you're feeling about your safety. What do you think? The lifeline is a possibility, that's something you can consider.
d56_u91.utterance: That I will definitely- I definitely wanna do that.

d56_u95.prev_utt: Mm-hmm. What else do you think it would take for you to feel safe?
d56_u95.utterance: Well, I- maybe they-they-- When I first came home, they had somebody come and show me some things in-in the house, but maybe a refresher of that, and they told me that I should exercise and-and, um, I guess I could-- Maybe support, maybe I'm looking for-for maybe a buddy or something, some way that I could be reminded. I'm feeling a little, you know, I was moving along and things were feeling more positive, it's sort of like two steps forward and-

d56_u97.utterance: -one step back, but now it's to step forward and three steps back.

d56_u99.utterance: So, um, is there, yeah, like a support somehow?

d56_u101.utterance: My daughter is very good and she calls me, but you know, she-she lives in Seattle, she lives far away.

d56_u103.utterance: So- and I don't wanna impose on my neighbors or my friends.

d56_u113.prev_utt: -and, uh, and-and also might help you organize and connect up with other services that might be out there or do things, um, like that. I don't know. What it- how does that sound to you?
d56_u113.utterance: Yeah, that would be good. Do you think I should try to go back to the Tai Chi?

d56_u115.prev_utt: Yes. I was going to say the other thing that I would say- that I would consider because the senior center, and I know you were really active in the senior center before-

d56_u117.prev_utt: -and I'm wondering if you feel like there's support there. They have a lot of activities going on at the senior center that- and I- and I don't know what was in the Tai Chi included that might be- not only serve the purpose of the exercise but really help with some of that support.
d56_u117.utterance: Yeah. I guess I've kind of gone to the extreme. I tend to do that. Yeah. So, keep moving?

d56_u127.prev_utt: -but we can make it less likely.
d56_u127.utterance: Okay. Okay. Okay. I-I'm willing to start again, so to speak.

d56_u131.prev_utt: Yeah. Takes a lot. Takes a lot. And you're the only one that'll- that can know what it is you're willing to work through that fear for.
d56_u131.utterance: Well, I'm willing to work through my fears and difficulties to be in my little house with my little dog and my little garden. I've been there for- since my husband and I got married, and that's where we lived, and I don't want to give it up yet.

d56_u137.utterance: -I-I am. And I feel like I have some help.

d56_u141.utterance: So, am I being a baby?

d56_u149.prev_utt: Yes. d56_u151.prev_utt: And we can work together to make sure that-- And-and Dr. Fields too, I know, is very interested in that. We can work together to do what we can to keep you there.

d56_u153.utterance: Not yet? Okay. Yeah. I was sort of- I-I was sort of hesitant to tell you-

d56_u157.utterance: -this, but, um, uh, I'm sort of glad I did. I'm very glad I did.

d56_u161.prev_utt: - to help you feel safer. And I hope you're going away home today feeling safer.

d58_u11.utterance: And I-- And really, it's kind of an excuse, I guess, cause I-I could probably make the time, but it's-it's easier to just keep working or-

d58_u15.prev_utt: But that goal of the half-marathon, you know, it's really important that you were willing to put all the time into getting ready for it, which, from what I've heard from other people, is almost like a job in and of itself.

d58_u35.utterance: Um, well, um, I like-- The bike is pretty good. Uh, even the uh, you know, the kind of a rolling machine is okay. And the uh, the elliptical. Any of that's fine. I-I really don't, uh-- I don't dislike any of it. Kind of once you get into the rhythm, yeah, it's fine

d61_u1.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u1.prev_utt: Hi Mrs. Smith, my name is Terri, I'm one of the nurses who works with Dr. Fields.
d61_u1.utterance: Well, I remember you. Yeah, we met once before.

d61_u5.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u5.prev_utt: And I know that, uh, Dr. Fields talked with you last time about maybe trying a tai chi class to see how that would go, and I wanted to-to check in with you and see how tai chi went.
d61_u5.utterance: Well, I went once. Yeah and, um, it was very-very beautiful to see and the instructor was very nice, but I felt kind of self-conscious because I'm still in my walker. And I had to sit in the chair. I couldn't, you know, do what they were doing.

d61_u13.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u13.prev_utt: Uh-huh. So, you thought it was beautiful and you liked the instructor, but you were a little self-conscious because you were in a chair?
d61_u13.utterance: So, it's-- it was-- I simply felt self-conscious. A lot self-conscious.

d61_u17.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u17.prev_utt: What were you hoping to achieve with the, um, by going to tai chi?
d61_u17.utterance: Well, like Dr. Fields told me, it helps with balance, and I'm still having the wobblies. So, I was really hoping that I could get to the point where I could benefit from what they had to offer. Um, yeah, mostly my balance, mostly my balance.

d61_u23.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u23.prev_utt: Uh-huh. What is your overall goal? What are you working towards?
d61_u23.utterance: I wanna go home. Yes, I really do.

d61_u27.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u27.prev_utt: Mm-hmm, and what is it that's important to you about getting home?
d61_u27.utterance: Everything. I want to be with my little dog.

d61_u29.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u29.utterance: He's really so cute, and I miss my garden.

d61_u31.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u31.utterance: And I just miss being independent, going to sleep when I want to sleep and getting up when I want to get up and-and, uh, cooking for myself. The independence. Sure I miss being independent.

d61_u33.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u33.prev_utt: Uh-huh. So, you're wanting to get home to your dog, your garden, back to your life, your independence?

d61_u37.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u37.prev_utt: What do you think you need to do in order to be able to achieve that goal of getting home?
d61_u37.utterance: Well, they told me that I need to be able to walk down the hallway and back, even with the walker, being secure and not with the wobblies. And I haven't gotten there yet.

d61_u41.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u41.prev_utt: And do you agree that that's what you need to do in order to be able to get home?
d61_u41.utterance: Yeah. I-I don't want to fall. I-I've had friends that had that happen. So, um, I-I agree a little, with some hesitation, but I do agree.

d61_u47.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u47.prev_utt: Uh-huh, and tell me how your physical therapy is going?

d61_u53.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u53.prev_utt: So, it sounds like, um, you can see that you're making some progress in physical therapy and that you were hoping that the tai chi would help you with the wobblies. Uh-huh?

d61_u57.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u57.prev_utt: And so, are you wanting to go back to tai chi?
d61_u57.utterance: Um, yes-yes I-I do because I-- my friend, I think I told you, really, really loves it and I just, I wish I could go back, and yes I do. I'm not making much sense, but I do.

d61_u59.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u59.prev_utt: Uh-huh. I think it's important, um, that you know that you're the one who has to make the decision about whether or not tai chi works for you.

d61_u61.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u61.utterance: Yeah. It's-it's-- I can't make that-- It wouldn't be fair for me to say it does or doesn't. It didn't that one time, but you know.

d61_u67.prev_utt: -and it sounds like you like the instructor-

d61_u69.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure

d61_u73.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure
d61_u73.utterance: Yeah, and the arrangement, arrangements a little complicated.

d61_u75.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure

d61_u91.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure

d61_u95.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure

d61_u113.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure

d61_u123.topic: increasing activity; taking medicine / following medical procedure

d77_u1.prev_utt: Hi, Mrs. Smith. It's really nice to see you again. I see you're back to follow up on the stroke you had. How are things going for you at the rehab facility?

d77_u5.prev_utt: What kind of things have you been in your rehab?
d77_u5.utterance: Oh, they have me doing all kinds of things in different machines and stuff. Yeah, it hurts.

d77_u7.prev_utt: It hurts? Oh, I'm sorry to hear that. Where are you having pain?
d77_u7.utterance: Well, just about every joint like especially my knees. They're really-- They have me doing some leg things that-that-that is it really necessary?

d77_u11.prev_utt: But what are your goals for the long term?

d77_u13.prev_utt: Oh, of course, of course. And what are the things that you'd like to be able to do once you get home?
d77_u13.utterance: Everything. I wanna- I wanna, play with my dog. I miss my dog. I wanna cook for myself. I'm a very independent person and I wanna do things for myself.

d77_u15.prev_utt: Yeah, yeah. And so that's a very important goal to be able to get back home, to be able to get back to your independence. Have you thought about what it might take to get there?

d77_u17.prev_utt: Mm-hmm. Yeah, you're absolutely right. And it's also going to be very important that once you're home, you're able to continue on a regular activity program. Have you thought about what that might look like?

d77_u23.utterance: I have a friend who, uh, does it and she just raves about it. She loves it.

d77_u25.prev_utt: Well, you know, Tai Chi is one of the best ways to get your balance back after you've had something like a stroke. And it's also really good for preventing falls. And if you wanna be home and you wanna be doing the things you wanna do and going for walks with your dog, it's very important to make sure that you don't fall 'cause that would cause more problems down the road.
d77_u25.utterance: Absolutely. I do not want to fall, for sure.

d77_u27.prev_utt: So what do you think about Tai Chi? Is that something you think you might be able to try sometime?
d77_u27.utterance: Well, I-I hadn't really thought about it, but yeah I guess, I guess.

d77_u29.utterance: Like I said, my friend talks about it and-and it's very pretty. I've seen pictures, you know.

d77_u31.prev_utt: Yeah, yeah, yeah. Well, it's not that easy to get started. You do certainly have to have some motivation to want to do it. Um, and when you first start, oftentimes you do feel a little wobbly or a little insecure.
d77_u31.utterance: Well, I don't see how I could do it. I-I'm still in a walker, you know.

d77_u35.prev_utt: You could. You can talk to the instructor and that way you won't fall, you'll feel confident and you'll start to learn some of the moves. And then gradually over time, as you get a little bit better at doing the moves in a chair, you can start to stand up, use the chair to lean on, and then eventually, you'll be able to get to the point where you can do it on your own.

d77_u37.prev_utt: You know, it cuts your risk of falls in half. It also helps to reduce pain although that's not a short-term benefit, you do have to stick with it for at least three to six months to start have it help reduce your pain. But it does have a number of things that I think would get you to your goals of being home and able to play with your dog and doing your own cooking and things like that.

d77_u39.prev_utt: I do Tai Chi. I do it three days a week and it's really helped my balance as well.
d77_u39.utterance: Oh, okay. Well, yeah. Um, listen, anything that's going to get me home and if you do it and you recommend it, I'll try it.

d93_u1.prev_utt: So there are a lot of different directions that we could take. Um, you've mentioned wanting to make changes in your physical activity. You've mentioned wanting to make changes in your eating habits and also just wanting more body confidence. Um, what- what's on your mind is as far as a- as a change topic for the rest of our session today?
d93_u1.utterance: I think the activity piece is the kind of low-hanging fruit that I see. Um, I feel like it's gonna be harder for me to change some of my nutrition habits right out the gate, but if I can get into maybe an activity routine, that that could be good to help maybe some of the other changes happen later.

d93_u3.prev_utt: Yeah. Okay. So physical activity is feeling like the easiest change to look at first.

d93_u5.prev_utt: Great. So tell me a little bit more about your motivators for getting started in being more physically active. I know you shared energy levels and I know you've shared, um, that you'd like to see a boost in your mood and feeling less irritable and stressed. Any other benefits that really make you wanna make this change right now?
d93_u5.utterance: Yeah, I think just to feeling like physically stronger, um, like physically more able. Uh, last night I like struggled with the jar of salsa, like opening it. So I think that just stuff like that, um, you know, would be in addition to mood and being more productive and energy and all that stuff. Um, yeah, that that would be a definite end goal for me too. And then really to like, I think if I am more active, I think my body image or my body confidence would improve also.

d93_u9.prev_utt: Great. So on a scale from zero to 10, zero being not at all ready to make a change in the area of physical activity, and 10 being let's- let's do this. I'm excited. I'm ready. Um, where- where do you fall on that scale?
d93_u9.utterance: Hmm, I'd say I'm about an eight.

d93_u13.prev_utt: Uh, why didn't you pick a six?
d93_u13.utterance: Well, like I said, I just, I've identified like a lot of things that I think would be good. Um, if I were to be more active and I definitely wanna have that improved mood and energy, um, and feel better about myself. Um, so yeah, all of those things I think are what's really driving that- that rating.

d93_u23.prev_utt: - and- and what activities you might end up, um, choosing.

d105_u15.prev_utt: Mm-hmm. So and what would you-- What would- What would help you get to building up to it? Spending more time there.

d105_u21.utterance: I was kinda busy with some other things, but, um-

d105_u23.prev_utt: Mm-hmm. But you made it-- You made it one day instead of zero days. That's fantastic.

d105_u29.prev_utt: Even with this, you know, pretty horrendous schedule going on.
d105_u29.utterance: Yeah. It's been a little-little hectic, you know. And, uh-- But, I-I don't like it too much because there's all these younger guys that can lift a lot more weight than me or they can stay on the treadmill longer and it-it-it's a little discouraging, you know. 'Cause I don't know if you've noticed, I'm not buff and they are. And it's-it's a little discouraging to think how much work it's gonna take to get, you know, kinda back towards that.

d105_u31.prev_utt: So you-you'd like to get buffed?
d105_u31.utterance: No, but, um, when-when I'm not at the gym, and I am my normal rational self, I realize that I'm, you know, way, way past the age of where I would really even want to do that, let alone want to spend the time it takes. d105_u33.prev_utt: So, but for right now, it sounds like the-- just having the pants fit better- sounds really, you know, like it's making you feel good about yourself and-

d105_u37.prev_utt: What other positive things have you noticed about the exercise?
d105_u37.utterance: Well, I noticed-- Well, I-I still need to work on my diet a lot. I haven't-- I-I'd like to say that by working out at the gym, I have, uh, I've -I've modified my diet, but I haven't very much. I've gotten a little bit better with that, but I'd like to do a lot more.

d105_u39.prev_utt: In what way have you gotten a little bit better?
d105_u39.utterance: Um, a little bit less junk food. Um, like at times, when I'm like I feel like, "Oh, I think I'll just go have a candy bar," or some worthless thing like that I'll actually have second thoughts before I do it.

d105_u41.prev_utt: So you're at the second thought part. And what do you think would-- might take you, uh, over to actually doing it if you wanted to?

d105_u43.utterance: -you know, and then as I'm looking at that double or triple fudge four-decker of ice cream Sunday thing, you know, that somebody is eating, I would say, "Wow, that would be about two hours on the treadmill." Then-then that would be probably-- the-- that would keep me from actually ordering one of those.

d105_u45.prev_utt: Oh, okay. The payoff just wouldn't be worth that two hours of treadmill versus that double fudgy browny thingy.
d105_u45.utterance: Right, decadent-- Why do they put the word decadent in food?

d105_u49.utterance: Okay. But it seems to be going so far so good. I-I guess, you know, I can like, you know, um, I-I'm-I'm pretty pleased with who-- how it's going on. Um, I really like one that's like month to month and doesn't require me to pay out for like a year because, in the summertime, I just don't use that when the weather is nice, I like to be outside.

d124_u2.prev_utt: Well, I think, um, like when I was really active in the past, I enjoy going to the gym and I like that regardless of what's happening with the weather outside, that-that's always an option. Um, so I've kind of already started to look and see, like, how much gym memberships cost in the area. d124_u8.utterance: Yeah.
